dream: Last night I had a dream that I was trying to find my dad. I was thinking about buying a car or borrowing my mom's car to drive and go see him. It felt like I haven't seen him in forever. I had a feeling of sadness in the middle of my chest and  missing him and I wanted to hurry up and go see him. I was thinking of asking my grandma chmielewski where he was and stopping at her house. I always have dreams of looking for my dad and not being able to find him. At one point I was in KY grandma's garage and looked at the wall and there was multiple plates or plaques of carousel horses and there were 3 that in my mind were the most "important" at another point I was at an Italian restaurant and I was going to order a pizza and a beef brisket and bring my dad the brisket for dinner. The whole dream I missed my dad and was wondering where he was. At another point there were these really weird/kinda gross stuffed animals that had live like grub inside and it was squirming and moving. I may have dreamt that because when I was a kid my dad used to buy me Mexican jumping beans and my dad would always tell me there was a worm inside.... ialways that that was interesting. Anyway after the dream I woke up and missed my dad even more realizing he is dead in real life and I will never see him again
interpretation:
Based on the details you provided, it seems that your dream reflects your deep longing and sadness for your father. The dream symbolizes your desire to reconnect with him and the frustration of not being able to find him. The act of trying to find your dad by buying or borrowing a car represents your effort and determination to connect with him, even though it feels like a long time since you last saw him. The feeling of sadness in your chest indicates the emotional pain associated with missing him.

The mention of your grandmother's house and the plates or plaques of carousel horses may represent a sense of nostalgia and cherished memories related to your dad. These specific plates or plaques could symbolize certain significant and cherished memories or aspects of your relationship with your father.

The scene in the Italian restaurant, where you plan to order a pizza and bring your dad a beef brisket, may symbolize your longing to share meals with him and spend quality time together. It signifies your desire for his presence in your life and the desire to recreate those moments.

The appearance of the weird and somewhat gross stuffed animals with live grubs inside may stem from a childhood memory of your father buying you Mexican jumping beans. It could represent a mix of fascination, curiosity, and the uniqueness of your relationship with your dad.

Overall, your dream reflects your yearning for your father's presence and the grief and acceptance that come with the realization that he is no longer living. It is completely natural to miss and long for your loved ones, especially after such a vivid dream.
title: "Yearning for the Unseen: A Journey to Find My Father"

dream: I had a dream where I was outside and I there were homes all around and people were leaving their homes for some reason I don't understand why but I was in this one house and it turned into a school and the school where children of the ages of six and seven and when I was in there helping the teacher I looked down and notice my foot and when I took my shoe off my food was this light clear cottage cheese looking form and on the top of it was black spot and a hole and when you looked under the hole there was more black I told the teacher I couldn't stay any longer and I had to go and as I was walking away there was all these young girls in different ages from 7:00 to 9:00 in white outfits some with fails on them some with hats with fails on them and then the last thing I remember is that they told this little boy he had to come to the Gathering which he didn't want to do and they said it's for you and they put a gold tassels around his neck and he was in like a little graduation gown.
interpretation:
In this dream, the homes surrounding you symbolize a sense of community or familiarity. The transformation of the house into a school suggests a shift in focus or learning new things. The presence of children between the ages of six and seven represents innocence, growth, and development.

The peculiar observation of your foot indicates a concern or issue with your foundation or stability. The light clear cottage cheese-like form represents a delicate or flimsy situation, while the black spot and hole symbolize an underlying problem or negativity. This may reflect a hidden flaw or vulnerability that you have become aware of.

Your decision to leave the school demonstrates a sense of self-preservation and instinctual need to distance yourself from potentially harmful or detrimental circumstances. The appearance of young girls in white outfits with veils or hats suggests purity, innocence, and spirituality. They may represent benevolent or guiding forces in your life.

The little boy being told to come to the Gathering, despite his reluctance, indicates an invitation or obligation to embrace change or growth. The gold tassel around his neck symbolizes recognition, achievement, or honor. The graduation gown represents a transition or advancement to a new stage in life.

Overall, this dream suggests a recognition of underlying problems or vulnerabilities in your life and the need to prioritize self-care and distance yourself from harmful situations. It also highlights the importance of embracing change and growth, even if it initially feels uncomfortable.
title: "The Mysterious Transformation: From Homes to School, and a Strange Creature in My Foot"

dream: I had a dream about my ex girlfriend and my mom. In this dream i feel like I’m always giving the words of encouragement to get the to be more positive about a circumstance. There is also a man there who is always around them both when they would hang out with eachother and I met the man in a baseball/tennis field. The man seemed to lack lots of confidence and when I approached them to speak to my mom and ex they would walk away and ignore me almost like my words were annoying. I felt like I was wasting energy in trying to communicate to them. In the dream one day I see them walking to a baseball/tennis practice which is my ex’s practice I believe because she plays softball but the man is has a tennis racket and she has on her softball clothes and they notice I’m there to support and I call them to come over but they keep walking and ignore me. Almost like they are repulsed by me.
interpretation:
This dream could symbolize a few different things related to your relationship with your ex-girlfriend and your mother. The theme of giving words of encouragement and trying to be positive suggests that you often played a supportive role in their lives, perhaps acting as a source of motivation and encouragement in difficult situations.

The man who is always around them may represent an aspect of yourself or a figure in your life who lacks confidence. This could indicate that you sometimes feel insecure or struggle with self-doubt, especially in comparison to your ex-girlfriend and your mother.

The baseball/tennis field could symbolize competition and the different activities they are involved in, with your ex playing softball and the man playing tennis. This could reflect the different areas of their lives that they are focusing on, while you may feel left out or disconnected.

The fact that they walk away and ignore you could suggest feelings of rejection or being unnoticed. It may feel like they are not receptive to your attempts at communication or supportive gestures, which can be frustrating and leave you feeling drained.

Overall, this dream could be indicating that you are experiencing feelings of being overshadowed or left out in your relationships with your ex-girlfriend and your mother. It may be worth exploring these emotions further and considering how they could be impacting your well-being and self-esteem.
title: "Lost Words: The Frustrating Encounter with My Ex and Mother"

dream: I'm eating my birthday dinner at a restaurant. Unable to decide what I want, I order several entrees. I get up to pee. The men's restroom has no urinals. There is one lonely urinal outside the bathroom door, in plain view of the other diners, but I use it anyways.  I take my food and a girl I went to high school with drives me to her house, where we eat but her house shifts and spills the food everywhere. At some point, all my clothes vanish except for my t shirt, but nobody seems to notice but me.
interpretation:
This dream seems to revolve around themes of decision-making, embarrassment, and vulnerability. Eating your birthday dinner at a restaurant suggests a time of celebration or self-reflection. However, being unable to decide what you want to eat may reflect indecisiveness or uncertainty in your waking life.

Ordering several entrees could represent a desire for variety and options, but it may also indicate a fear of missing out or feeling overwhelmed by choices. The act of getting up to pee symbolizes the need to release or let go of something in your life. However, the absence of urinals in the men's restroom and the lone urinal in plain view suggest feelings of vulnerability or exposure.

Being driven to a girl from high school's house may symbolize revisiting memories or aspects of your past. Eating together in her house can represent familiarity or comfort. However, the shifting and spilling of the food could imply a lack of stability or control in your current circumstances.

The disappearance of your clothes, except for your t-shirt, and nobody seeming to notice may suggest a feeling of being exposed or vulnerable in front of others. It could reflect a fear of being judged or having your true self revealed.

Overall, this dream suggests a conflict between your desire for variety and options, and the fear of making the wrong choices or being seen in a vulnerable state. It may be important to explore any feelings of indecisiveness or vulnerability in your waking life and find ways to address them.
title: "The Unshakeable Urinal: A Chaotic Birthday Feast and Disappearing Attire"

dream: Some of my friends and family find ourselves in this arid and bleak landscape dotted by the occasional structure that seem to have no obvious purpose. I ask someone “what is this structure for here for example and they tell me it’s a pumping station for the hotel. I ask if it’s a big hotel, noticing a large structure in the distance and they tell me that yes it’s a luxury hotel. “Are we going to see it?” I ask and they say yes. We go to the hotel but then decide to visit what was the original city which is far underground and begin to descend the stairs that will take us to it. I seem to be carrying the lionshare’s of the animals and children that need assistance and every time we pause I have to gather them all up again and not accidentally leave anyone behind. Meanwhile the rest of my party has pulled out far ahead of me and left me behind.
interpretation:
This dream may symbolize your feelings of being left behind or left out by your friends and family in some aspect of your life. The arid and bleak landscape represents a sense of desolation or emptiness, possibly reflecting a lack of fulfillment or satisfaction in your current situation. The structures in the dream, such as the pumping station and luxury hotel, may represent superficial or materialistic aspects of your life that you are questioning the purpose or value of.

The desire to visit the original city underground suggests a longing to reconnect with something deeper or more authentic. The act of descending the stairs signifies a process of introspection and self-discovery. However, your responsibility for carrying the majority of the animals and children represents a burden or weight that you are carrying alone. This could symbolize your caring nature and willingness to assist others, but also suggests that you may feel overwhelmed by the demands placed upon you.

Overall, the dream may indicate a need for a balance between your own needs and the responsibilities you have towards others. It may be helpful to reflect on your relationships and consider if you are putting too much emphasis on taking care of others at the expense of your own well-being.
title: "Lost in an Arid Landscape: Journey to the Hidden City Beneath"

dream: I was in a tiny house and there was a boss whom I wanted to impress or didn't want to be embarrassed in front of came to visit or inspect where I lived. That person went to the bathroom. They seemed pleased with my tiny house. Someone showed me some dust on my dresser and indicated for me to hurry and whipe before the other person came into the room. I was cleaning white dust from a dresser. There were white stones that were part of the structure that came off as I wiped the dust. I put the dust on a white shirt and also the pebbles. As I went to pick out the pebbles, the dust was separated so that the pebbles were on top and the dust was in a different fold of the shirt. As I saved the pebbles for later use, one fell to the floor, I didn't pick it up. It seemed too far, I'll do it later. I shook off the dust into a trash can and when I was done I didn't have a white shirt in my hands but a clear plastic bag. I walked away without picking up the pebble that fell.
interpretation:
This dream could symbolize a desire to impress or avoid embarrassment in a specific area of your life. The tiny house represents your personal space or current circumstances. The boss figure represents authority or someone you look up to. The fact that they seemed pleased with your tiny house suggests that you have been doing well in this area, meeting expectations or even surpassing them.

The dust on the dresser represents imperfections or small details that need cleaning up. This indicates that there may be minor areas where you feel you need to improve or tidy up in order to maintain a good impression. However, the fact that the dust was white and came off as you wiped it suggests that these imperfections are relatively minor and easily fixable.

The white stones that were part of the structure symbolize the solid foundation of your actions or work in this area. The fact that they came off as you wiped the dust indicates that while focusing on minor details, you may unintentionally be altering or compromising the foundations of your efforts.

The act of putting the dust and pebbles on a white shirt signifies you collecting and storing the imperfections and minor challenges. However, as you went to pick out the pebbles, the dust separated and fell into a different fold of the shirt. This suggests that you may be separating and categorizing the challenges or imperfections in your mind, perhaps prioritizing what needs to be addressed first.

The pebble that fell to the floor represents a missed opportunity or challenge that you didn't address or resolve. It may signify a task or an issue that you feel is not urgent enough to take care of immediately. This could imply procrastination or a tendency to put off certain challenges or responsibilities.

Lastly, the clear plastic bag replacing the white shirt signifies a shift in your perception or approach to handling these challenges. The clear plastic bag represents transparency and objectivity. It suggests that you may be starting to see these imperfections or challenges more objectively, without the emotional attachment linked to the white shirt.

Overall, this dream indicates your desire to maintain a good impression or avoid embarrassment in a specific area of your life. It highlights the need to pay attention to minor details and address any imperfections. It also suggests the importance of maintaining a solid foundation while not neglecting or postponing important tasks or challenges that arise.
title: "Tiny House Troubles: Impressions and Pebble Predicaments"

dream:
3/11/2024
I had a dream about a group of kids who all went on a trip with their teacher in South Carolina and another group shows up, so does a small kid with brown, curly hair, looks up in the sky and see's an all white plane. He starts waving at the ship and he gets shot down by someone in one of the plane. The kid's teacher tells them to run, and don't stop running, because once the people see their faces, they'll always come for them. The kids run away, but the oldest girl, Caroline, turns around and see's their teacher getting shot down. They keep running and the two younger kids say their getting tired, but the oldest guy, Jessie, tells them that they need to get away from the people. They see an all white church and the younger girl asks to go inside and pray, but Jessie tells her that it's the white people church and they just park their fancy cars outside of it. They see an old blue and tan Camero and decide to jack it to get away quicker. Jessie decides to drive and backs up into the church, and a little old lady tries to run after them, but he figures out how to drive it. They decide to go to the farthest part of the state they can get. The car eventually breaks down in front of an older lady's house and she allows the kids to stay with them, on the condition that they burn the car. Months later, the woman get's a call from the kid's parents, saying they were also being hunted, and they'd be by the old woman's house. It takes a couple weeks but the parents arrive, Jessie and the younger girl's parents are alive, but Caroline and the younger boy's mom died two days before she could make it, her body is in the back seat. They bury her in the backyard and the only one that can console her is Jessie. Their parents leave, and all four kids stay with the older woman. Years later, both Caroline and Jessie have jobs and Caroline stays during the day to teach the two younger siblings. She saves up enough money ($200) to buy a car, and decides to buy Jessie a tan and blue Camero, like the one they all escaped in
interpretation:
This dream appears to reflect themes of fear, survival, strength, and resilience. The group of kids going on a trip with their teacher in South Carolina represents a sense of innocence and a safe environment. However, the arrival of another group and the shooting of the small kid with curly hair suggests a sudden and traumatic interruption in their peace. The teacher warning them to run and never be seen by the people symbolizes the need to escape a dangerous situation and hide from those who wish to harm them.

The running and the death of their teacher indicate a fight for survival and the loss of their protector. The older girl, Caroline, witnessing the death and the decision of the kids to keep running portray the difficult choices they have to make in order to ensure their safety.

The mention of a white people's church with fancy cars outside represents a symbol of privilege and exclusion. The decision to steal a blue and tan Camero to escape quicker highlights their resourcefulness and the need for a means to escape their pursuers effectively.

The encounter with the older lady who allows them to stay with her, under the condition of burning the car, illustrates the trade-offs they must make to find temporary refuge. The arrival of their parents later on portrays the hope of reunion and the acknowledgment that their loved ones are also being hunted.

The death of Caroline and the younger boy's mom shortly before reaching safety further emphasizes the tragedy and loss they experience. The burial and the comfort offered by Jessie symbolize their need to grieve and find support within their close group.

The years passing, Caroline and Jessie having jobs, Caroline teaching the younger siblings during the day, and Caroline saving up to buy an identical car for Jessie indicate the resilience and determination of the kids to build a new life together. It signifies their ability to overcome their past traumas and find stability and support within their chosen family unit.

Overall, this dream suggests that during times of hardship and adversity, we find strength and solidarity in our connections with others, and with determination and resilience, we can create a new path forward.
title: "Escape from the White Ship: A Journey of Survival and Hope"

dream:
Narrow highway above water at night.  I was scared of it because I could fall off. The highway went up and down.  

I then find myself at work but it's school. I walk into a room that looks different from work. It's a classroom.  I forgot my project.  I forgot to bring a book. I ask my boss if I could drive home quickly to get it. She had a mean look and said no.  I drove home anyway. I search the house for my project but all I found was a clear green crushed soda bottle. I ran to my car but forgot because I was late getting back.  The ground was dusty.  I forgot my book but next to my car was a small table with a few books and magazines.  I grabbed a floppy children's book then got into a black car and drove back to work/school.  I get there nervous because I didn't have everything.  I walk into the classroom.  They have green paper with questions about their projects. Each student was grading their own work.  The class ended right when I got there.
interpretation:
This dream may highlight feelings of insecurity and fear of failure. The narrow highway above water at night represents a challenging and uncertain path in your life. The fear of falling off symbolizes the fear of making a mistake or losing control in this situation.

The transition to work but being in a school setting suggests a feeling of being unprepared or inadequate in your professional life. Forgetting your project and book reflects a sense of forgetfulness or feeling unorganized. Asking your boss for permission to drive home and her mean refusal may represent a perceived lack of support or understanding from authority figures in your life.

The search for your project but finding a crushed soda bottle symbolizes frustration and disappointment in not finding what you need. The dusty ground may symbolize a feeling of neglect or being left behind in some aspect of your life.

Finding a small table with books and magazines near your car symbolizes finding alternative resources or solutions in an unexpected place. Grabbing a floppy children's book suggests a feeling of settling for less than ideal or feeling unprepared with the resources available to you.

Arriving late to the classroom and seeing the green paper with questions about projects could signify a missed opportunity or feeling out of sync with your peers. The fact that each student was grading their own work may symbolize a sense of self-evaluation and self-criticism.

Overall, this dream suggests feelings of anxiety, insecurity, and a fear of not being fully prepared or meeting expectations in your professional or academic life. It may be beneficial to assess your feelings of self-worth, seek support or guidance, and work on building confidence and organization skills.
title: Fearsome Highway, Forgotten Projects, and Self-Grading Class

dream: My dream began with a road trip with my family; I think we were going camping. I remember texting my boyfriend and he informed me he got a new car which was the color red. I do not remember after that, but I recollect coming home and the town was a disaster.  My two sisters with one of their husbands and I got back into the car to drive away because everyone outside was becoming absurd. We were at a stop light in a Chevrolet truck, and I seen a group of men who were vandalizing buildings. They were painting them in the color red such as a McDonalds and a supermarket building. I made eye contact with a few of them and when they realized that we were trying to escape they got in a truck and started following us. I do not recall why we made a stop and got out in a random parking lot, but I remember the group of men getting out as well and my sister and I were in danger. My other sister was attempting to protect us and told us to run away and to get back in the car and I recollect looking out the window and seeing the group of men kill my sister with a large axe. Her husband drove away fast trying to protect us and I just remember crying in the front seat as I turned my head seeing tears falling down his cheeks as well. We weren’t sure where to go or what to do but he insisted on driving to his mom's house but then, he remembered they were on a vacation. The group of people who were vandalizing buildings where everywhere not just in our town. The last thing I remember is telling my sisters husband we needed to go inside a church because the vicious group of people would not go in there.
interpretation:
This dream may symbolize feelings of vulnerability, fear, and the need for protection in your waking life. The road trip with your family represents a sense of togetherness and support. The mention of your boyfriend getting a new car in a vivid color could represent a new change or excitement in your romantic life.

The town being a disaster may suggest a feeling of chaos or instability in your surroundings. The vandalized buildings, painted in red, could symbolize danger or aggression. The group of men following you and your sisters may represent a threat or an overwhelming situation that you are trying to escape from.

The tragic event of your sister being killed with a large axe could symbolize a loss of support or protection in your life. Your tears and the tears of your sister's husband suggest deep emotional distress and grief. The decision to go to his mother's house for safety, only to remember they are on vacation, indicates a lack of available refuge or support in your current situation.

The idea of seeking shelter in a church reflects a need for spiritual guidance or a desire for a sense of sanctuary amidst turmoil. Overall, this dream may be highlighting your fears or anxieties and the need for safety, protection, and stability.
title: "Road Trip Nightmare: Escape from the Red Menace"

dream: My dream began with a road trip with my family; I think we were going camping. I remember texting my boyfriend and he informed me he got a new car which was the color red. I do not remember after that, but I recollect coming home and the town was a disaster.  My two sisters with one of their husbands and I got back into the car to drive away because everyone outside was becoming absurd. We were at a stop light in a Chevrolet truck, and I seen a group of men who were vandalizing buildings. They were painting them in the color red such as a McDonalds and a supermarket building. I made eye contact with a few of them and when they realized that we were trying to escape they got in a truck and started following us. I do not recall why we made a stop and got out in a random parking lot, but I remember the group of men getting out as well and my sister and I were in danger. My other sister was attempting to protect us and told us to run away and to get back in the car and I recollect looking out the window and seeing the group of men kill my sister with a large axe. Her husband drove away fast trying to protect us and I just remember crying in the front seat as I turned my head seeing tears falling down his cheeks as well. We weren’t sure where to go or what to do but he insisted on driving to his mom's house but then, he remembered they were on a vacation. The group of people who were vandalizing buildings where everywhere not just in our town. The last thing I remember is telling my sisters husband we needed to go inside a church because the vicious group of people would not go in there.
interpretation:
This dream seems to be reflecting a sense of chaos and danger in your life. The road trip with your family represents a journey or pursuit of something together. The mention of your boyfriend's new red car may suggest a feeling of change and excitement in your relationship or personal life.

The town being in a disaster could symbolize feelings of instability or turmoil in your waking life. The group of men vandalizing buildings and painting them in red, including recognizable establishments like McDonald's and a supermarket, may represent a threat to your sense of safety, comfort, and familiar surroundings.

The death of your sister in the dream could symbolize a loss or the fear of losing someone close to you. It may also reflect a sense of vulnerability or helplessness in a dangerous situation. The tears and shared emotions with your sister's husband indicate a deep emotional connection and the need for emotional support during trying times.

Driving to his mom's house, only to realize they are on vacation, suggests a sense of uncertainty and not knowing where to turn for help or shelter. The decision to seek refuge in a church represents a desire for protection and spiritual guidance during difficult times.

Overall, this dream may indicate feelings of fear, vulnerability, and a need for safety and security in the face of chaos or threats in your waking life. It may be helpful to assess any current challenges or stressors you are experiencing and seek support from loved ones or professionals to navigate through them.
title: "Road Trip Nightmare: Escaping the Red Menace, Tragedy Strikes in the Parking Lot"
